1.title: Angela Cavalluzzo: Retired Exec. Assistant
1.plot: Bronx-born Italian American Angela Cavalluzzo talks about her Rolodex, the usefulness of powdered buttermilk, and how she got the nickname 'Lamb'.

2.title: Carlos Zapata: Office Manager
2.plot: Carlos Zapata gives us a tour of his mom's apartment in Brooklyn where he grew up, filled with holiday decorations, a scary clown, and treasured family photos.

3.title: Dale Henderson: Cellist
3.plot: Cellist Dale Henderson introduces his coin collection, eclectic food tastes and the power of Eastpak's lifetime warranty.

4.title: Sean Pierce: Animator, Musician
4.plot: Musician Sean Pierce of the Toilet Böys talks about his encounter with the pope, the joy of surfing and Carlos the dog's unfortunate medical problems.

5.title: Madra Furman: Student
5.plot: Middle school student Madra Furman shares her passion for reading and journaling, an obsession with owls, and what to do if someone steals your diary.

6.title: Jean Liebegott: Flower Coordinator
6.plot: Meet spunky 84 year old great-grandmother Jean Liebegott and find out why a clean house is the sign of a misspent life.

7.title: Tecla Esposito: Musician
7.plot: Tropical-Electro-Pop musician Tecla Esposito finds her lost umbrella, talks about the good side of voodoo dolls, and FYI... her friend really did steal her leopard print shoes.

8.title: Peter Twickler: Media Editor
8.plot: Wordsmith Peter Twickler extols the virtues of Philip K. Dick, BAWLS cola, and proper sentence construction. See if you can fathom his inexplicable love for psychotic cats.

9.title: Asie Mohtarez: Comedian
9.plot: Comedian Asie Mohtarez gets on her Bollywood flava, shows off her hot high heels, and reunites with her childhood love of Pound Puppies.

10.title: Edgar Cortes: Dancer
10.plot: Ballet Trockadero dancer Edgar Cortes shows off his playful side with a colorful collection of objects from Norwegian trolls and fish pillows to handmade dolls and toilet seat covers. Who knew that rubber duckies came in so many varieties of devil?

11.title: Angie Pontani: Burlesque Dancer
11.plot: Miss Exotic World and burlesque performer Angie Pontani relates the wisdom of retro sewing manuals, the best music for getting dressed up to and ooh la la, what she does with her cotton candy spray.

12.title: Ron English: Artist
12.plot: Pop artist and painter Ron English takes us on a tour of his home and studio, revealing his artistic process, how a grin can turn into a skull, his love of deer, and the importance of lifting weights to get away from the cops. Christian fanatics beware: know ye scripture before arguing with Ron!

13.title: Clayton Patterson: Photographer
13.plot: Photographer and activist Clayton Patterson shares some of his vast archive of Lower East Side media and history: the camera that shot the Thompson Square Park police riot, LA2's significance as Keith Haring's collaborator, and his backup plan to win Mega Millions.

14.title: Jim Muscarella: Film Producer
14.plot: Producer, Festival Director and #1 Dad Jim Muscarella shows off some of his eclectic collecting tastes, how to make a coaster out of gaff tape, and his membership in the elite Coney Island Polar Bear club. And yes, he really does think he's going to finish that half-eaten apple in the fridge.

15.title: Patty Heffley: Artist
15.plot: Artist Patty Heffley takes us on a tour of her old school Chelsea loft complete with dumpster dive treasures, punk scene photography, biker jackets and retro decor. Ever wonder what a 25 year old gummy bear would look like? Here's your answer.

16.title: Marco Gruelle: Importer/Exporter
16.plot: Importer/exporter and world traveler Marco Gruelle brings back the smell of pure sex from southeast Asia, knows the difference between a strawberry and a human heart, and fends off evil spirits from his front porch. Oh, and you might want to think twice before taking a crap in his basement bathroom.

17.title: Mark Byrne: Actor
17.plot: Actor Mark Byrne lets us peek inside his world of exotic teas, compost heaps, lucid dreams, and mementos gathered from wanderings through life and world. Don't ask about 'Uncle Freddie', he wouldn't tell me either.

imdb.plot outline: What do your possessions say about you? Each episode of 'Here's the Thing...' profiles a person through pictures of twenty-some objects in their home. Get to know artists, students, doctors, secretaries and more through the often important, sometimes mundane and occasionally unknown objects found in their homes.
imdb.title: Here's the Thing...
plot: What do your possessions say about you? Each episode of '_Here's the Thing..._ (qv)' profiles a person through pictures of twenty-some objects in their home. Get to know artists, students, doctors, secretaries and more through the often important, sometimes mundane and occasionally unknown objects found in their homes.::Rick Swanson
